title: 110_s1582
content:
The Act titled "Hydrographic Services Improvement Act Amendments of 2008" defines key terms. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892) is amended to define "hydrographic data" as information acquired through various surveying methods and used in providing hydrographic services. "Hydrographic services" are defined as the management, maintenance, interpretation, and dissemination of various types of information derived from hydrographic data. The Coast and Geodetic Survey Act of 1947 defines the functions and duties of the Coast and Geodetic Survey, including the production of nautical charts and databases, development of nautical information systems, and related activities. SEC. 3. FUNCTIONS OF THE ADMINISTRATOR. Section 303 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892a) is amended to include provisions for the Administrator to procure, operate vessels and equipment, and provide hydrographic services to promote safe marine transportation. The Administrator is responsible for procuring vessels, equipment, and technologies for safe navigation, maintaining operational expertise in hydrographic data acquisition and services, installing real-time monitoring systems, acquiring data to support conservation efforts, responding to emergencies, disasters, and homeland security needs, and creating joint centers. The Administrator is responsible for obtaining mission assignments, creating joint centers with other entities, and awarding contracts for hydrographic data acquisition in accordance with the Post-Katrina Emergency Management Reform Act of 2006. SEC. 4. HYDROGRAPHIC SERVICES REVIEW PANEL.

The panel consists of 15 voting members appointed by the Administrator, with nonvoting members including the Co-directors of the Center for Coastal and Ocean Mapping/Joint Hydrographic Center and up to 2 NOAA employees. Voting members are experts in disciplines related to hydrographic data, marine transportation, port administration, and other relevant fields.

SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

Section 306 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations. The Administrator is authorized appropriations for nautical mapping, charting, hydrographic surveys, contracting for surveys, operating survey vessels, and geodetic functions for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. For fiscal years 2009 to 2012, the Administrator is authorized appropriations for nautical mapping, charting, hydrographic surveys, geodetic functions, tide and current measurement functions, and acquiring a replacement hydrographic survey vessel. The allocated amounts for each function increase annually. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED NOAA CORPS STRENGTH. The total number of authorized commissioned officers in the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Commissioned Officer Corps will increase from 321 to 379 effective October 1, 2009, subject to certain conditions being met. These conditions include the submission of ship recapitalization and aircraft remodernization plans to Congress, availability of appropriated funding, and justification of organizational needs for each fiscal year.
